isis.stitle: DOUBLE DIAPHRAGM ANCHORLOK SPRING BRAKE - BRAKE CHAMBER SERVICE - REASSEMBLE

svcproc.title: REASSEMBLE
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 11 for the following steps.

step1.para: Inspect the service clamp assembly (Item 10), the service brake housing assembly (Item 5), the service return spring (Item 7) and service push rod (Item 6). If any structural damage is noted, replace with new part.
Wipe the surface of the service push rod plate (Item 8) clean off any oil, grease or dirt. Check to see that vent holes in the service brake housing (Item 5) are not plugged.
Place the new service diaphragm (Item 9) in the adapter and center the service brake housing (Item 5) over the diaphragm and adapter.

Check to see that the diaphragm is properly seated between the adapter and housing lip. Reassemble the service clamp assembly (Item 10). Check carriage bolts and clamp assembly for proper seating around the adapter and housing lip. Torque nuts to 20 to 30 lb.ft. (27.1 to 40.7 Nm). Remove vise grip pliers from the service push rod.
Apply a maximum of 120 PSlG air pressure to the service port and check the diaphragm seal for leakage by applying a water and soap solution to the service clamp area (no leakage allowed).
